wikipedia_page.main: Elizabeth Bentley (1767–1839) was an English poet.

response: Today Leapor's work is celebrated for its sharp observations about life as a woman in the 18th century. She remains one of the few female labouring-class writers of the period, along with Ann Yearsley and Elizabeth Bentley.
Elizabeth Bentley (1908–1963) was an American spy.
Elizabeth Bentley may also refer to:
*Elizabeth Bentley OES Scholarship Fund, started in 1947 by the Order of the Eastern Star
*Elizabeth Bentley (1767–1839), author of Tales for Children in Verse, lived at 45 St Stephen's Square.
